shortdesc.ph: Sets whether to turn on the flashlight.
Sets whether to turn on the flashlight.
Sets whether to turn on the flashlight.

ul.li: You must call this method after . The setting takes effect after the camera is successfully turned on, that is, when the SDK triggers the callback and returns the local video state as LocalVideoStreamStateCapturing (1).
This method is applicable to Android and iOS only.

You must call this method after . The setting takes effect after the camera is successfully turned on, i.e., after the SDK triggers the callback and the local video state is localVideoStreamStateCapturing (1).
This method is applicable to Android and iOS only.

You must call this method after . The setting takes effect after the camera is successfully started, that is, after the SDK triggers the callback and returns the local video state as LOCAL_VIDEO_STREAM_STATE_CAPTURING (1).

plentry.pd:
Whether to turn on the flashlight:
: Turn on the flashlight.
: (default) Turn off the flashlight.

Whether to turn on the flashlight:
: Turn on the flashlight.
: (default) Turn off the flashlight.

Whether to turn on the flashlight:
: Turn on the flashlight.
: (default) Turn off the flashlight.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
